newsitem.title: USA: USAir does not renew AviAll contract.
newsitem.headline: USAir does not renew AviAll contract.

text.p: USAir Group Inc has decided not to renew its five-year contract for CFM56-3 engines with Greenwich Air Services Inc's recently acquired operations in Dallas, Texas, Greenwich said Monday.
It said USAir had not been satisfied with Aviall Inc's "turntime" performance before Greenwich took it over in June.
"USAir had made a decision to rebid the contract in the open market," it said.

"The decision by USAir is a disappointment, but not unexpected," it added. "The loss of the USAir contract was anticipated in our acquisition plan and research analysts who cover the company have assumed the loss of the contract in their estimates for fiscal 1997 and beyond."
Greenwich said the contract expires October 8.
Since the Aviall acquisition, the induction rate of USAir CFM 56 engines in Dallas has averaged about $5.2 million per month, it said.
To date, the operation has offset about 35 percent of the anticipated USAir monthly volume with an increase in future sales with new and existing customers.
Headquartered in Miami, Florida, Greenwich is a gas turbine engine repair and overhaul company.
